alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 6:03PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Yuma County through 630 PM MDT... At 603 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northeast of Cope, or 17 miles south of Yuma. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Yuma County, including the following locations... Abarr. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
